page.title: 04THE CHURCHES OF SUTTON VENY
page.content: Sutton Veny has two churches,but only one is used now.The old church is Duck Street and is called St.Leonards. It was built in the thirteenth cent- ury. In 1865 it began to sink because of marshy ground and after that it was not used for thirty years. Half of the church is in ruins. The Church of St.John The Evangelist in the High Street was built in 1886 to replace the old church. It has a spire and was built with stone from Frome. Outside there are many graves. A great many are Commonwealth War graves. On the south side of the church there is a sundial. The Vicar of Sutton Veny also takes services at the Tytherington and Heytesbury churches.
